content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

Sure, here is a function in Julia that should accomplish the task:

```julia
using Markdown

function extract_julia_code(md::String)::String
    code_blocks = Markdown.parse(md, context = :block) |>
        x -> filter(isa(x), x, CodeBlock) |>
        x -> map(x -> x.content, x) |>
        x -> filter(startswith(x, "```julia\n") && endswith(x, "\n```"), x) |>
        x -> map(y -> replace(y, r"^```julia\n" => ""), x) |>
        x -> map(y -> replace(y, r"\n```$" => ""), x)
    return join(code_blocks, "\n\n")
end
```

This function uses the Markdown.jl package to parse the markdown document and extract the code blocks. It then filters out the Julia code blocks, removes the code fences, and joins the code blocks together with a newline.
